ul.li: ‚úì Team Members - Go to: Settings > Users & Companies > Users
‚úì Shredding Equipment - Go to: Maintenance > Equipment (shredders, balers, trucks)
‚úì Service Routes - Go to: Field Service > Configuration > Routes

ol.li: Click Create to add new team
Enter Team Name: "On-Site Shredding", "Facility Shredding", "Mobile Unit Alpha"
Add Team Members: Technicians, drivers, shredding operators
Assign Shredding Equipment: Specific shredders, balers, trucks
Configure Service Areas: Geographic zones team covers
Enable NAID Compliance if team handles AAA-level destruction
Assign Service Routes for on-site shredding services
Configure Capacity Limits: Max bins/day, weight limits
System auto-assigns work orders to team based on availability
Team dashboard shows: Active jobs, pending pickups, equipment status

ul.li: On-Site Shredding: Mobile trucks with mounted shredders, customer location destruction
Facility Shredding: Warehouse-based teams, high-volume industrial shredding
Hard Drive Destruction: Specialized team for physical drive destruction (NAID AAA)
Paper Baling: Teams managing paper recycling, bale creation, quality control
Emergency Response: On-call teams for urgent destruction requests (legal holds)

field.p:
üöÄ Key Features:
‚Ä¢ Work Order Assignment: Auto-route shredding jobs to available team based on location/capacity
‚Ä¢ Equipment Tracking: Monitor shredder hours, maintenance schedules, breakdowns
‚Ä¢ Route Optimization: Assign on-site teams to geographic clusters for efficiency
‚Ä¢ Capacity Planning: Prevent overload by tracking max bins/weight per team per day
‚Ä¢ Performance Metrics: Tons shredded, certificates generated, avg response time
‚Ä¢ NAID Certification: Track which teams certified for AAA/AA/A level destruction
‚Ä¢ Mobile Access: Team members see assigned jobs on tablets/phones
‚Ä¢ Chatter Integration: Team communication, job notes, issue escalation

üí° Pro Tips:
‚Ä¢ Create separate teams for on-site vs facility - different skill sets/equipment
‚Ä¢ Assign backup team leader for coverage during vacations/illness
‚Ä¢ Set capacity limits realistically - prevents burnout and missed SLAs
‚Ä¢ Use team dashboard daily to monitor workload distribution
‚Ä¢ Cross-train members across equipment types for operational flexibility
